nl.inl.blacklab.forwardindex

Interface ForwardIndex

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<AnnotationForwardIndex>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ForwardIndexImplSeparate

    public interface ForwardIndex
extends Iterable<AnnotationForwardIndex>
    A component that can quickly tell you what word occurs at a specific position of a specific document. This allows access to all annotations for a document, as opposed to AnnotationForwardIndex, which allows access to just one.

        Open a forward index. Automatically figures out the forward index version and instantiates the right class.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the forward index. Writes the table of contents to disk if modified.

      • addDocument

        void addDocument(Map<Annotation,List<String>> content,
                 Map<Annotation,List<Integer>> posIncr,
                 org.apache.lucene.document.Document currentLuceneDoc)
        Store the given content and assign an id to it. Note that if more than one token occurs at any position, we only store the first in the forward index.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to store
        posIncr - the associated position increments, or null if position increment is always 1.
        currentLuceneDoc - Lucene document

        Returns:
